result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Hunter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample.

Filed by Atty Leonie Dolch
Filed by Atty Leonie Dolch

Defendant Matthew A Hunter in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 2 yr. probation, $518 costs, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Ct. 2 read in and dismissed. Court granted 3 days jail credit.

Jury trial at 02-11-2016 08:30 am
Defendant's motion to suppress denied by the court.

Attorney Mark Gumz appeared telephonically, special for Atty. Raabe. Defendant not present. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed the matter. Court found no basis to find limit was 35. Sign controlled the limit. Court found officer had probable cause. Motion to suppress denied.

Defendant, Matthew A Hunter, appeared in person with Atty. Gumz telephonically, special for Atty. Raabe. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Speed zone in which defendant was stopped was 35 mile per hour zone. Defendant not exceeding the speed limit. ADA Long argued the state sets the limit by state statute and village of Pardeeville does not have the authorization to change limits on state hwys. Court will revisit the matter. Hearing reset to 3:30 today. Defendant excused for 3:30 hearing if he has to work today.
Oral ruling at 07-31-2015 11:30 am
Documentation from Village of Pardeeville filed by Atty Adam Raabe.

Defendant Matthew A Hunter in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court noted Atty. Raabe did not provide proof of speed as instructed. Atty. Raabe stated that was all the municipal could gave him. Court noted it needs the date when it went into effect. Raabe to provide to the court within next 10 days.
filed by ADA Long
Defendant's brief in support of motion to supress filed by Atty Adam Raabe.
Oral ruling on July 1, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
#4, ordinance regarding speed limits
#3 DVD from squad
#2 area map.

Defendant Matthew A Hunter in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Long addressed concerns over motion not being specific.  Atty Raabe specified the motion.  State called witness (Deputy T. Brehmer).  Direct examination.  Cross examination.  Exhibit #1 marked (map of North end of Pardeeville).  Court will not take judicial notice of map.  Exhibit # 2 (Same map).  Deputy confirmed accuracy of map.  Exhibit # 3 (DVD from squad).  Video was played for witness.  Atty Raabe requested Exhibit # 2 and # 3 be marked as received.  State does not object.  Court received exhibits #2 and #3.  Exhibit # 4 Marked (Pardeeville Ordinances).  Atty Raabe would like this marked as received.  State objects.  Court took judicial notice of code of ordinances.   Specifically effective 1/19/15.   Court addressed concerns over exhibit #4.  Atty Raabe addressed those concerns.  Closing arguments.  Court will brief the matter.  Atty Raabe requested two weeks.  Court gave date of 4/30/15.  Court would like certification of speeding ordinance on date of arrest.  State requested beginning of June.  Court will allow until June 1.   Atty Raabe requested May 8, 2015 for deadline to file brief.  Court approved.  June 12, 2015 date given for replies.  Court will give ruling on 7/1/15 at 1:00 pm.  11:03/11:37.

Defendant Matthew A Hunter in court with attorney Leonie Dolch for Atty Raabe.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. stands mute, not guilty pleas entered, matter to be set for jury trial Br. 1, 20 days to file motions, bond cont'd
Defendant's notice of motion and motion to supress fruits of an illegal stop filed by Atty Adam Raabe.

Defendant Matthew A Hunter in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State called witness.  Direct examination.  No cross examination.  Copy of certified JOC filed by State from Dane County Case.  No objection by defense.  Court marked as received.  Probable cause found.  Defendant bound over for further proceedings.  Information filed, reading waived.  Bond remains.  Arraignment scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
